shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables the local audio capture.

section.p: The audio function is enabled by default when users joining a channel. This method disables or re-enables the local audio function to stop or restart local audio capturing.

The difference between this method and are as follows:
: Disables or re-enables the local audio capturing and processing. If you disable or re-enable local audio capturing using the method, the local user might hear a pause in the remote audio playback.
: Sends or stops sending the local audio streams without affecting the audio capture status.

section.title: Applicable scenarios
section.p: This method does not affect receiving the remote audio streams, and () is applicable to scenarios where the user wants to receive remote audio streams without sending any audio stream to other users in the channel.

section.title: Call timing
section.p: You can call this method either before or after joining a channel. Calling it before joining a channel only sets the device state, and it takes effect immediately after you join the channel.

section.title: Related callbacks
section.p: Once the local audio function is disabled or re-enabled, the SDK triggers the callback, which reports (0) or (1).

ul.li: : (Default) Re-enable the local audio function, that is, to start the local audio capturing device (for example, the microphone).
: Disable the local audio function, that is, to stop local audio capturing.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See for details and resolution suggestions.
